SP: 0001

S4 CORE

entry.title: SAP Joule for consultant
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

As I‚Äôm working in SAP and closely with SAP clients, and more and more of them are asking questions about SAP Joule SAP‚Äôs smart digital assistant. I‚Äôd like to better support them, and I‚Äôm looking for advice or best practices from SAP Specialist who‚Äôve already helped clients get started with Joule.

To summarize what I‚Äôve gathered so far (and please correct me if I‚Äôm wrong):
‚Ä¢ SAP Joule is a digital assistant integrated into SAP systems. It can answer natural language questions, surface data quickly, and even guide users step by step through business processes.

‚Ä¢ To use Joule, clients need two things:
1. Access to the SAP Cloud (where Joule lives): usually available if they already use SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SuccessFactors, etc. If not, a new SAP BTP subaccount can be created.
2. A Joule license : this is the "key" to activate Joule. Without this, even if the cloud environment is ready, they can't access the assistant.

My main questions:
‚Ä¢ What are the exact steps for me to verify if a client already has access to Joule (license and technical setup)?
‚Ä¢ If they don‚Äôt, how do we guide them in activating Joule or requesting access?
‚Ä¢ Are there tools or standard SAP notes to help consultants evaluate a client‚Äôs readiness for Joule?

Any advice, checklists, or experiences would be much appreciated! üôå
Thanks in advance for your help.
Best regards,

entry.title: Error when trying to display APPS - Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi everyone!

I‚Äôm currently using Joule inside SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and when I ask Joule to show a Sales Order, I get the following error:

 

There are no intents, current user is authorized to (check BTP navigation service is up-to-date),
Source: GET, /navigation/api/v2/inbounds?pageSize=1000000,
user 'user@email.com', semantic object type 'salesOrder'.
 OBS: Generic Email for security

The Manage Sales Orders app appears and works normally in the SAP Fiori Launchpad, so the app itself is available.
It seems the issue is that Joule cannot find the intent or inbound for the salesOrder semantic object.

I also tried accessing /navigation/api/v2/inbounds, but received the following response:

403 Forbidden - The request has been blocked by UCON.

I‚Äôd like to understand if anyone has faced a similar issue.current limitations of Joule integration in S/4HANA Public Edition?

Any insights, suggestions, or experiences would be greatly appreciated üôè

entry.title: Please Vote for these AI enhancements
entry.content:
If you want to start some proof of concept or proof of value on AI features

in SuccessFactors, check those ideas 

in Influence :

BUSINESS AI Dashboard with AI UNIT counter per user per month

Have a AI Settings menu to configure Modules / Features / threshold values

Allow uses to Interact with Custom Object via SAP Joule

Enable Cross Portlet Updates via SAP Joule

Improving Joule AI Compliance Message

Ability to Include Work Schedule Field in Use Case to Enable Working Time

Enable Job Code and Job Title Fields in Transfer Use Case (Joule)

Preferred Name Retrieval Not Supported in Joule Prompts

Vote for them so that when your POC is approved it may be included in futur roadmap.

entry.title: IAM for SAP Joule
entry.content:
üîê IAM for SAP Joule: Building Secure, Scalable AI Experiences
As organizations embrace SAP Joule and SAP Business AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) becomes the backbone of secure and seamless integration across business applications. Here‚Äôs what you need to know:

‚úÖ Why IAM Matters for Joule
SAP Joule is more than a conversational AI‚Äîit connects processes and data across multiple SAP applications. To achieve this, robust IAM architecture ensures:
Cross-domain access without compromising security.
Consistent user experience across integrated apps.
Compliance with enterprise cybersecurity standards.

üîë Core IAM Components
SAP Cloud Identity Services
Joule uses these services as its user store, enabling centralized identity management and role-based access.
OpenID Connect (OIDC)
The recommended protocol for secure integration between Joule and SAP Business AI.
Role Mapping & Session Management
Content is exposed based on role names, and user-to-role assignments occur dynamically during sessions.

üõ† Integration Flow
Initial Setup: Configure Joule with SAP Cloud Identity Services.
Common Data Model (CDM): Define which Joule functions map to specific roles.
Cross-Application IAM: Once the first app integrates with Joule, subsequent apps reuse the same IAM patterns.

üåê Navigation & Access
SAP Joule leverages SAP Build Work Zone for unified navigation across applications, ensuring smooth transitions for end users.

üí° Why This Matters
IAM for Joule isn‚Äôt just about authentication‚Äîit‚Äôs about enabling secure, intelligent collaboration across SAP‚Äôs ecosystem. As AI becomes central to enterprise workflows, IAM ensures trust, compliance, and scalability.

üëâ What‚Äôs your take? How do you see IAM evolving as AI-driven platforms like Joule become mainstream?

entry.title: Using Joule Studio Custom AI Agents to Query Case Status from ServiceNow
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm exploring a use-case with custom Joule Agents, and wondering if anyone has tried something similar yet with ServiceNow (preferably) or other case systems?

The scenario I'm after: An employee is logged into SuccessFactors and asks Joule something like ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the status of my case (ref: xxxxx)?‚Äù

The aim is for Joule to retrieve the case details from ServiceNow and return the update directly in the Joule chat, without the employee needing to switch systems (steps listed below).

  1. Use the employee's current SuccessFactors user context
  2. Call ServiceNow to get case/ticket status/details for that employee only
  3. Return the result directly in the Joule chat
  4. Uses the SAP Integration Suite or ServiceNow REST API exposed as a Skill

We already use the ServiceNow IntegrationHub SuccessFactors Spoke, and we maintain a shared user identifier between the systems, so user identity matching is already in place. I‚Äôd be interested to know if this can be leveraged alongside the Joule Agent.

Also, which approach would be recommended:

  • Joule ‚Üí SAP Integration Suite ‚Üí ServiceNow
  • Joule ‚Üí ServiceNow REST API directly as a skill

Regards,

Dauied Medhanie

entry.title: SAP Joule AI copilot integration with SAP Successfactor -lesson learned
entry.content:
SAP Joule AI copilot integration with SAP Successfactor

Recommended links for SAP joule activation and implementation

https://discovery-center.cloud.sap

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-btp-onboarding-series-joule-getting-started-with-joule-and-sap/ba-p/13575477

Refer the blogs from nageshcaparthy Product and Topic Expert from SAP

 

 

 

Comparison of SAP Jule copilot with others for understanding. A nice one taken during one lecture.

Feature

SAP Joule

Microsoft Co pilot

Google Duet

Core Focus

Entire Enterprise process

365 Dynamics

Its workplace kind of tool

Native Integration

S4HANA, SAP SAC, SAP Ariba, SAP Concur, SAP DataSphere etc..

MS Apps+Azure

Google Apps, Vertex AI

Data Context

Strong Data Foundation

Recent actions

Semi Business process

Custom Model

SAP trained + partner LLM

Open AI

PaLM2

 

 

Important point to consider before activation of Joule : Ensure that region where the joule subaccount will be activated should be same as SAP Start too.

Joule supported DC‚Äôs

https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/serviceguide/data-centers-supported-by-joule

In our scenario joule subaccount is region EU30 where as SAP Start is in region EU20 you will face the below error

SAP Start is available in below regions

https://help.sap.com/docs/start/sap-start/data-center-availability

 

 

 

 

In above situations where SAP Joule and SAP start are in different regions and only resolve is you need to drop the subaccount and recreate in a region supported by both i.e we selected EU20.

Some constraints of SAP Joule

https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/integrating-joule-with-sap/constraints-for-joule

 

 

 

 

One more important aspect of SAP joule implementation in SAP Successfactor is that you need to ensure that SAP Successfactor is integrated with SAP IAS with SSO. If you have not done this then you can follow the below link for the same which includes activation of SAP People Analytics.

https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-blog-posts-by-members/how-to-enable-stories-in-people-analytics-for-sf-systems-provisioned-before/ba-p/13644586

A proper planning is needed on how the users are replicated into IAS which will act as a HUB for central user store for integration of SAP Joule with other SAP Products like SAP SF, SAP Ariba, SAP SAC, SAP Concur, SAP Datasphere.

It is mandatory requirement by Joule that whichever the SAP products you are planning to integrate should be available in the same IAS tenant. If you already have a such IAS instance where SAP cloud products application are configured with SSO ( Assuming that IAS is already integrated with your ADFS )  and users have a unique Global ID maintained.

Global user ID plays a critical part in complete implementation of Joule and it should be same in both SF and IAS. If you are using IAM as the central user store and all the users are replicated into it from SAP SF.

 

There are 2 options on how you can maintain a unique global ID for users in IAS ..

Option 1: Replicate the users from SAP SF into IAS and further IAS will be used to replicate the same and required users to other SAP cloud products.

Option 2: If your landscape doesn‚Äôt have SAP SF then create users in IAS and replicated to other SAP Cloud products.

https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-identity-services/cloud-identity-services/import-or-update-users-for-specific-application

once joule integration with SF is completed you can proceed with configuring the use cases.

Below are couple of issues during this integration process..

 

Issue of content creation is resolved by following SAP note -3638058 - [SuccessFactors Joule Configuration] get <Connectivity/Unauthorized>: Could not fetch the content from the design-time destination. XXX> Error when running SF Content Channel in Work Zone

 

This was due to sfapi credentials which were updated again at sf and destination dt.

 

 

How to activate the use cases in SF

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/setting-up-and-using-joule-in-sap-successfactors/use-cases-supported-in-joule

use cases supported by joule

 

If any use cases are not available at SF create incident with SAP.

A proper plan needed before rolling out. consideration of the number of messages allowed. Once you reach the limit you will be charged accordingly.

Number messages allowed are as mentioned below.

 

SAP working on rolling out SAP Joule across all Cloud products. Even though there is documentation available  but during implementation there are integration issues.

any APIs available to get data?

entry.title: Enabling Joule on multiple SAP SuccessFactors instances
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am seeking clarification regarding the enablement of the Joule license on multiple SAP SuccessFactors instances (e.g., Test, Dev, and Prod).

From the SAP documentation, I understand that:

- "To set up a Joule Preview tenant, subaccounts must be in the EU10 or EU30 data centers; otherwise, it is not possible to add Joule Preview entitlements."
- "A single Joule subscription can be integrated with multiple SAP products but only with one tenant per product. Therefore, it is not possible to use a single Joule subscription across multiple tenants of the same product."


I would like to know:

1) If a subaccount is not located in the EU10 or EU30 data centers, how can Joule be enabled in Test or Preview environments?
2) Considering the requirement to enable Joule on three SAP SuccessFactors instances (Test, Dev, and Prod), how can this be achieved? Is it possible to use the Joule service on multiple instances? What is the recommended approach in such cases?

Thank you in advance to anyone who can provide guidance or share experiences on this topic.
